definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from

sentences.english: And then to its position choice, some do, some shirk.
sentences.chinese: 然後再以自己的立場抉擇，有些做，有些推脫。

sentences.english: Start something you've been putting off.
sentences.chinese: 開始着手做你一直推脫的事。

sentences.english: Write down anything that cannot be pushed off to the following day.
sentences.chinese: 寫下那些不能推脫到第二天去做的事情。

sentences.english: You run around in a tizzy trying to do all those last minute things you procrastinated about the night before.
sentences.chinese: 你急急忙忙去做那些你前一晚上推脫沒做的瑣事。

sentences.english: Shirk, however, had quietly replaced the king Laoqin be holy raincoat.
sentences.chinese: 推脫不過，老秦只好默默地換上了王可聖的雨衣。

sentences.english: Keys. Oh…it is a reason that I can shirks .
sentences.chinese: 這就是我不能推脫的原因。
吉姆將罪責推脫得一乾二淨。

sentences.english: This is an excuse that we all use.
sentences.chinese: 這是我們常用的推脫之詞。

sentences.english: HanYing subsidizes master Dao Yin RenHui with the war had exhausted by evade James spirit.
sentences.chinese: 道賢用跟仁惠的戰爭曾經耗盡了精神爲由推脫詹姆斯。

definition: to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
